{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3145991,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-15T17:37:22.262Z","cooked":"

I’m encountering an issue where anytime I use RamseteCommand that calculates feedforward, the robot doesn’t drive the path correctly. Even a simple straight path defined by two points. It turns immediately randomly, and drives in a curve, and sometimes straight.
However, if I use the other constructor for RamseteCommand that doesn’t use SimpleMotorFeedForward, then the robot drives paths as expected.

I’m not sure where to even begin debugging this issue.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-02-15T17:37:22.262Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":47,"readers_count":46,"score":59.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":426919,"topic_slug":"issue-when-using-simplemotorfeedforward-in-ramsetecommand","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/issue-when-using-simplemotorfeedforward-in-ramsetecommand/426919/1","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3146023,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-15T17:56:59.481Z","cooked":"

It would help us to help you if you shared a link to your code (e.g. on GitHub), a video of the robot attempting to run a specific path, and a snapshot of any logged values graphed on ShuffleBoard.

Some things for you to try include: Adding a Field2d so that you can compare where the robot thinks it is to where it actually is; logging everything you can think of to SmartDashboard.

Common causes for this sort of problem include: swapping motor CAN ids; incorrect inversion of motors and encoders; and incorrect unit conversion on encoders, motors, and angles (degrees/radians).

With regard to unit conversion, I’m using the standard getRotation2d() method for the navX, which should provide data with the correct units and phase for pose estimation. And as far as encoders, we’re using the REV through bore encoder on the output shaft, with a 6" wheel. So our position conversion (from rotations to meters) is
0.1524 * Math.Pi
and our velocity conversion (from RPM to m/s) is
(0.1524 * Math.Pi) / 60

Also, seeing as the robot drives distances very accurately without SimpleMotorFeedForward, I’m inclined to believe that our unit conversions are correct.

The two methods of using the RamseteCommand cause it to output completely different things. How else have you adapted your code besides changing the RamseteCommand constructor?

From the API docs for the version with SimpleMotorFeedForward:

PID control and feedforward are handled internally, and outputs are scaled -12 to 12 representing units of volts.

From the other version:

Performs no PID control and calculates no feedforwards; outputs are the raw wheel speeds from the RAMSETE controller, and will need to be converted into a usable form by the user.
